intro: Henriettea bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows from a short, thick rootstock and has a sprawling or upright growth habit depending on environmental conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Henriettea bracteosa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry climates and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
